item.title: 你在火星殖民地的工作是什么？
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: 银行计划下周出售 86.5 亿欧元赛诺菲收购债务
item.description: 各家银行正准备卸载支持 Clayton Dubilier & Rice 公司收购赛诺菲公司消费者健康部门股份的 86.5 亿欧元（95 亿美元）一揽子债务。【原文：Banks are gearing up to offload the €8.65 billion ($9.5 billion) debt package backing Clayton Dubilier & Rice’s purchase of a stake in Sanofi SA’s consumer health division.】

item.title: 前俄罗斯州长因违反制裁规定面临英国审判
item.description: 克里米亚一个具有重要战略意义的港口城市的前俄罗斯省长因无视金融限制而受到制裁，目前正在伦敦接受审判。【原文：A sanctioned former Russian governor of a strategically important port city in Crimea is standing trial in London for flouting the financial restrictions.】

item.title: 法国经济因贸易疑虑和政治不稳定而放缓
item.description: 法国统计局称，由于担心全球贸易战和政治危机对公共开支的影响，法国经济陷入增长乏力的困境。【原文：France’s economy is mired in sluggish growth, weighed down by concerns of a global trade war and the impact of a political crisis on public spending, the country’s statistics agency said.】

item.title: 智能手表先驱 Pebble 重新发布苹果手表替代品
item.description: 埃里克-米基科夫斯基（Eric Migicovsky）的智能手表初创公司Pebble Technology Corp.于2016年被Fitbit收购，他正带着一家新公司Core Devices LLC和两款仿照Pebble原始硬件设计的产品重返这一领域。【原文：Eric Migicovsky, whose smartwatch startup Pebble Technology Corp. was bought by Fitbit in 2016, is returning to the space with a new company, Core Devices LLC, and two products modeled after Pebble’s original hardware.】

item.title: 甲骨文权衡安全支持和少量股份以达成 TikTok 交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，甲骨文公司正在权衡出售 TiKTok 美国业务的提议，该提议将要求甲骨文公司提供安全保证，并在一家新的美国实体中持有少量股份，同时可能将该应用的重要算法留在中国人手中。【原文：Oracle Corp. is weighing a proposal for a sale of TiKTok’s US operations that would have it provide security assurances and take a small stake in a new American entity while potentially leaving the app’s influential algorithm in Chinese hands, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 加纳寻求控制可可局 20 亿美元的债务负担
item.description: 加纳陷入困境的可可局已开始对其 320 亿塞地（20 亿美元）的债务进行审查，新任首席执行官誓言要在可可产量下降的情况下加强其资产负债表，以更好地支持生产商。【原文：Ghana’s embattled cocoa board has started a review of its 32 billion cedis ($2 billion) debt pile, with the new chief executive vowing to shore up its balance sheet to better support producers amid falling cocoa output.】

item.title: 高盛、麦肯锡认为追求欧洲冠军是 M&A 的驱动力
item.description: 据该地区的一些顶级顾问称，随着与美国的地缘政治紧张局势和贸易关税推动欧洲大陆的公司进行整合，欧洲可能会成为全球并购领域难得的亮点。【原文：Europe could emerge as a rare bright spot in global M&A, as geopolitical tensions with the US and trade tariffs propel companies in the continent to consolidate, according to some of the region’s top advisers.】

item.title: 华尔街期权-ETF 热潮升温，71 项申请创历史新高
item.description: 千亿美元期权 ETF 市场的先驱者一口气申请了 70 多只新基金，尽管人们担心行业过度拥挤和投资者疲惫不堪，但该公司仍赌注十足地认为，投资产品将再次蓬勃发展。【原文：A pioneer of the $100 billion options-powered ETF market has filed for more than 70 new funds in one go, in a bet that amped-up investment products will boom anew despite fears of industry overcrowding and investor exhaustion.】

item.title: 智利中右翼总统竞选人希望削减企业税
item.description: 智利中右翼总统候选人伊芙琳-马特伊（Evelyn Matthei）表示，她希望将智利的企业税率从 27% 降至 18%，因为她的竞选团队正努力在今年的大选中保持领跑者的地位。【原文：Chile’s center-right presidential candidate Evelyn Matthei said she wants to slash the country’s corporate tax rate to 18% from 27% as her campaign seeks to hold onto its front-runner status in this year’s election.】

item.title: 德国具有里程碑意义的消费狂潮获得议会批准
item.description: 德国立法者通过了一项具有里程碑意义的支出方案，朝着为国防和基础设施释放数千亿欧元债务融资迈出了重要一步，预示着数十年预算紧缩政策的终结。【原文：German lawmakers passed a landmark spending package, taking a major step toward unlocking hundreds of billions of euros in debt financing for defense and infrastructure and heralding the end of decades of budget austerity.】

item.title: 科技巨头拖累股指，美国股市重陷跌势
item.description: 美国股市周二下跌，科技公司拖累主要股指走低，因为在美联储周三做出决定之前，投资者仍对经济感到担忧。【原文：US stocks declined on Tuesday, with technology companies dragging major indexes lower as investors remain concerned about the economy ahead of the Federal Reserve’s Wednesday decision.】

item.title: 2017 年以来美国首次爆发 H7N9 禽流感引发健康担忧
item.description: 美国密西西比州一家家禽养殖场自 2017 年以来首次发现致命 H7N9 禽流感疫情，引发了新的健康担忧。【原文：The first outbreak in the US of deadly H7N9 bird flu strain since 2017 was detected in a Mississippi poultry farm, raising fresh health concerns.】

item.title: 意大利梅洛尼警告关税可能引发通货膨胀
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼警告说，关税可能会引发通货膨胀，并敦促欧盟与美国达成协议，避免贸易战。【原文：Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni warned that tariffs could raise inflation and urged the European Union to find a deal with the US to avoid a trade war.】

item.title: 摩洛哥中央银行降低利率，通胀率保持稳定
item.description: 摩洛哥中央银行连续第二次下调基准利率，表达了对通货膨胀的信心，尽管人们担心唐纳德-特朗普的保护主义政策会扰乱全球贸易。【原文：Morocco’s central bank cut the benchmark interest rate for the second consecutive time, voicing confidence about inflation despite concerns about how Donald Trump’s protectionist policies are roiling global trade.】

item.title: 战略公司计划 5 亿美元优先股交易收购比特币
item.description: 战略公司计划出售 5 亿美元的美元永久优先股。【原文：Strategy plans to sell $500 million of dollar-denominated perpetual preferred stock.】

item.title: 美国汽车产量创一年来最大增幅
item.description: 美国工厂产出创一年来最大增幅，原因是汽车产量激增带动了更大范围的增长，这有助于缓解人们对制造业疲软的担忧。【原文：US factory output rose by the most in a year as a surge in motor vehicle production led a broader increase that helps ease concern of weakening in manufacturing.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚比索因财政部长下台报道而下滑
item.description: 据当地媒体报道，哥伦比亚财政部长迭戈-格瓦拉（Diego Guevara）即将卸任，导致比索下跌。【原文：Colombia Finance Minister Diego Guevara is stepping down from his role, according to local media reports, sending the peso down.】

item.title: 欧盟和英国议会小组再次呼吁建立碳市场联系
item.description: 一个由英国议会和欧盟议会成员组成的机构再次呼吁考虑在 5 月峰会之前将英国和欧盟的碳市场联系起来。【原文：A body that includes members of the UK and European Union parliaments renewed a call to consider linking the UK and EU carbon markets ahead of a May summit.】

item.title: 法国巴黎银行称德国收益率因支出增加而面临触及 4% 的风险
item.description: 法国巴黎银行（BNP Paribas SA）的一位策略师表示，德国财政支出可能增加，这有可能将 10 年期国债收益率推高至全球金融危机期间的水平。【原文：A likely ramp-up in German fiscal spending risks pushing the 10-year bund yield to levels last seen during the global financial crisis, according to a BNP Paribas SA strategist.】

item.title: 纽约时报》烹饪应用程序找到战胜对手的正确食材
item.description:
《纽约时报烹饪》自 10 年前推出以来，凭借其时尚视频、海量食谱目录和活跃的家庭厨师社区，在众多领域中取得了成功。【原文：

After launching 10 years ago, NYT Cooking has succeeded in a crowded field with its blend of sleek videos, massive recipe catalog and an active community of home chefs.

】

item.title: 谷歌将在搜索结果中扩展医疗查询的人工智能答案
item.description: Alphabet Inc.旗下的谷歌公司（Google）表示，它将在搜索中扩展与健康相关的人工智能摘要，这也是其提高在健康领域影响力的努力的一部分。【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google said it will expand its health-related artificial intelligence summaries in search, part of an effort to improve its influence in the health sector.】

item.title: 斯塔默将英国福利削减 50 亿英镑，工党面临反叛风险
item.description: 英国工党政府宣布将通过削减福利开支每年节省数十亿英镑，其公布的有争议的改革措施引起了残疾人运动人士的批评，并使首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）所在的执政党出现分歧。【原文：The UK Labour government announced it would save billions of pounds a year by slashing welfare spending, unveiling controversial reforms which have provoked criticism from disability campaigners and divided Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s governing party.】

item.title: 旧金山巨人队向第六街合伙公司出售 10% 股份
item.description: 旧金山巨人队向 Sixth Street Partners 出售了 10% 的股份，成为向私募股权基金出售大量股份的体育团队之一。【原文：The San Francisco Giants have sold a 10% stake in the franchise to Sixth Street Partners, joining the list of sports teams that have sold a significant stake to private equity.】

item.title: 谷歌同意以 320 亿美元收购云安全公司 Wiz
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 公司同意以 320 亿美元现金收购网络安全公司 Wiz Inc.【原文：Google parent Alphabet Inc. agreed to acquire cybersecurity firm Wiz Inc. for $32 billion in cash, cementing a deal less than a year after initial negotiations fell apart because the cloud-computing startup wanted to stay independent.】

item.title: 暴风雨后美国房屋开工增幅超过预期
item.description: 在经历了与天气有关的暴跌之后，美国 2 月份的房屋开工率增幅超过了预期，这主要得益于独栋房屋建设的回升，这表明建筑商的激励措施正在支撑需求。【原文：US housing starts rose in February by more than forecast after a weather-related plunge, led by a pickup in single-family home construction that indicates builder incentives are underpinning demand.】

item.title: 销售税减免结束，加拿大通胀率升至 2.6
item.description: 加拿大的通胀率创下八个月来的最快增速，进一步限制了央行在贸易战中降息的能力，因为贸易战既会减缓经济增长，也会刺激物价上涨。【原文：Inflation in Canada grew at the fastest pace in eight months, further limiting the central bank’s ability to cut interest rates amid a trade war that will both slow economic growth and boost prices.】

item.title: 南非电力供应趋于稳定，断电损失骤降 83
item.description: 科学与工业研究委员会的一份报告显示，随着电力供应趋于稳定，去年南非经济因停电而付出的代价骤降 83%。【原文：The cost of power cuts to South Africa’s economy plunged 83% last year as supply stabilized, a Council for Scientific and Industrial Research report showed.】

item.title: 法国伦巴第敦促欧洲投资本国国防工业
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴（Eric Lombard）表示，欧洲必须将资金投入本国的国防公司，而不是花费在美国武器上，以保证其行动自由。【原文：Europe must channel money into its own defense companies rather than spending on American weapons in order to guarantee its freedom of action, according to French Finance Minister Eric Lombard.】

item.title: 对冲基金动量押注在动荡市场中一败涂地
item.description: 最简单的对冲基金策略之一今年却失灵了，因为曾经可靠的趋势，比如押注大型科技公司和美国经济表现出色，在今年大面积崩盘。【原文：One of the simplest hedge-fund strategies is misfiring this year as once-reliable trends, like betting on Big Tech and the outperformance of the US economy, crater en masse.】
